sentences: WASHINGTON  —   In a narrow victory for affirmative action, the Supreme Court on Thursday upheld a University of Texas program that takes account of race in deciding whom to admit, an important national decision that was cemented by the death of Justice Antonin Scalia.
(CNN) In a bit of a surprise, the Supreme Court, on a   vote, upheld a lower court ruling allowing the University of Texas to use race as one of many factors in its admissions process.

The U S Supreme Court on Thursday upheld the consideration of race in college admissions, rejecting a white woman’s challenge to a University of Texas program designed to boost the enrollment of minority students.

The Supreme Court on Thursday reaffirmed that the value of creating a diverse student body allows university officials to consider race in making admission decisions, upholding a University of Texas plan that has been the subject of years of legal battles.
Justice Samuel Alito wrote a sharp dissent, joined by Chief Justice John Roberts and Justice Clarence Thomas.
“Something strange has happened since our prior decision in this case,” is how Justice Samuel A Alito Jr on Thursday began his   dissent, more than twice as long as Kennedy’s opinion.
Writing in dissent, Justice Samuel Alito described the university’s program as ”affirmative action gone wild” because of the way it can benefit minorities from wealthy backgrounds.
The court’s three   justices dissented, and Justice Samuel Alito read portions of his   dissent, more than twice as long as Kennedy’s opinion, from the bench.
